statement: China Q4 GDP 4.5% y/y; Dec retail sales 0.9% y/y while industrial output 5.2% y/y.
market_link: China demand vs supply mix is a global risk-tone input; can spill into ES/NQ and USD via growth expectations and commodity-linked channels.

statement: China 2025 fixed-asset investment -3.8% y/y; property investment -17.2%; property sales area -8.7%.
market_link: China property/investment softness is a medium-term global growth and risk-sentiment overhang; relevant for US equities and cyclicals.

statement: Eurozone CPI final 1.9% y/y (prev 2.0%); core 2.3% y/y unchanged (final).
market_link: EU disinflation framing can influence global rates/FX via relative policy paths; affects UST duration (ZN/ZB) and EUR (6E).

statement: Canada Dec CPI 2.4% y/y (Nov 2.2%); CPI m/m -0.2%; ex-gasoline CPI 3.0% y/y.
market_link: Canada inflation surprises can move CAD rates/FX and spill into broader rates risk appetite; indirect relevance to UST complex and ES/NQ.

statement: US MOO imbalance: S&P 500 -$1.10B; Nasdaq 100 -$0.41B; Dow -$0.42B; Mag7 -$0.19B.
market_link: Large open/close imbalance prints can help explain late-day/into-open index-futures volatility; effect typically short-lived.

statement: Polymarket (asof Jan 19): Jan FOMC no-change 96.45%; cut 25bp 3.45% (event end Jan 28).
market_link: Near-term policy odds are a key driver for ZT/ZF and duration-sensitive equities (ES/NQ); USD often follows real-rate repricing.

statement: FRED snapshot: CPI core y/y 2.86% (Dec 2025); CPI headline y/y 3.03% (Dec 2025).
market_link: Inflation baseline anchors sensitivity of ZT/ZN and equity duration (ES/NQ) into PCE/CPI releases and Fed communication.

statement: US calendar shows a Bank Holiday on Jan 19 (today), which can thin liquidity in some sessions/venues.
market_link: Holiday conditions can amplify headline-driven moves and widen intraday swings across ES/NQ and Treasury futures due to reduced depth.
